issue.title: Can't open one app from another app
issue.body: ### Version 2.9.0 ### Reproduction link [https://github.com/dcolley/ns-open-app-issue](https://github.com/dcolley/ns-open-app-issue) ### Platform and OS info Mac Pro, 12.4 (21F79) ### Steps to reproduce I am able to open `myapp` from the IOS browser. Simply type: myapp://one?two=3 Also, browsing to a web page with `Launch App` also works I am not able launch the app from another app: ### What is expected? The other app opens, or IOS prompts for confirmation ### What is actually happening? sharedApplication.canOpenURL(url) reports false, so it can't open the custom url --- I tried Utils.openUrl(url) and https://github.com/nativescript-community/universal-links Neither of these are working.

comment.body:
We are locking this issue because it has been closed for more than 14 days. 
  
If the issue comes up again please open a new issue with additional details.

issue.title: no reaction when trying to open/download PDF in WebView
issue.body:
### Version
2.0.0

### Reproduction link
[https://play.nativescript.org/?template=play-vue&id=YFtZZL](https://play.nativescript.org/?template=play-vue&id=YFtZZL)
### Platform and OS info
any

### Steps to reproduce
Click on a link to a PDF on the website embedded in WebView

### What is expected?
the PDF is opened in a PDF view of the device or the PDF is downloaded

### What is actually happening?
nothing

<!-- generated by nativescript-vue-issue-helper. DO NOT REMOVE -->

comment.body:
We are locking this issue because it has been closed for more than 14 days. 
  
If the issue comes up again please open a new issue with additional details.

issue.title: chore(deps): bump minimatch and metalsmith-ignore

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

issue.body:
Bumps [minimatch](https://github.com/isaacs/minimatch) to 3.0.4 and updates ancestor dependency [metalsmith-ignore](https://github.com/segmentio/metalsmith-ignore). These dependencies need to be updated together. Updates `minimatch` from 0.2.14 to 3.0.4
Commits
  • e46989a v3.0.4
  • ddfacbd update brace-expansion
  • 55ed736 update package scripts and deps
  • eed8949 v3.0.3
  • ecabc57 Do not throw on unfinished !( extglob patterns
  • 81edb7c v3.0.2
  • 6944abf Handle extremely long and terrible patterns more gracefully
  • 8ac560e v3.0.1
  • 4f3a8bc update tap
  • 9cf2d88 Remove mentions of cache from readme
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view
Maintainer changes

This version was pushed to npm by isaacs, a new releaser for minimatch since your current version.


Updates `metalsmith-ignore` from 0.1.2 to 1.0.0
Changelog

Sourced from metalsmith-ignore's changelog.

v1.0.0

17 July 2018

  • Use multimatch() with the file list [#4](https://github.com/segmentio/metalsmith-ignore/issues/4)
  • Update multimatch to resolve deprecated dependency [#11](https://github.com/segmentio/metalsmith-ignore/issues/11)
  • add link to multimatch in readme [#6](https://github.com/segmentio/metalsmith-ignore/issues/6)
  • Removed unnecessary makefile and updated history 4631b17
  • Updated Packages 96ebad7
Commits
  • fbc4ba3 1.0.0
  • 4631b17 Removed unnecessary makefile and updated history
  • 96ebad7 Updated Packages
  • 2958c68 Merge pull request #4 from RobLoach/match-list
  • e3d5c2d Merge pull request #11 from woodyrew/patch-1
  • bc22bac Update multimatch to resolve deprecated dependency
  • 62a7ae7 Merge pull request #6 from arve0/patch-2
  • 1d4c894 add link to multimatch in readme
  • 190005a Use multimatch() with the file list
  • See full diff in compare view

issue.title: clearHistory is removing the Frame component when the Frame is in a component template
issue.body:
### Version
2.2.0

### Reproduction link
[https://play.nativescript.org/?template=play-vue&id=eA0tz9](https://play.nativescript.org/?template=play-vue&id=eA0tz9)
### Platform and OS info
Nativescript-Vue 2.2.0 / Android 7.0

### Steps to reproduce
My default Frame is in my App.vue component : 
```
<template>
    <Frame>
        <Page>
            <StackLayout>
                <Label>App.vue</Label>
                <Button text="Button" @tap="onButtonTap" />
            </StackLayout>
        </Page>
    </Frame>
</template>
```

I'm creating my Vue root instance without inserting Frame like that :
```
new Vue({
  render: h => h(App),
}).$start()
```

And when i use a $navigateTo with clearHistory set as true, the default Frame from App.vue will be removed and i will not be able to navigate anymore.

I've created a reproduction link with Nativescript Playground so you can see what's is happening

### What is expected?
The default frame has not to be deleted

### What is actually happening?
The default frame is removed

<!-- generated by nativescript-vue-issue-helper. DO NOT REMOVE -->

comment.body:
We are locking this issue because it has been closed for more than 14 days. 
  
If the issue comes up again please open a new issue with additional details.

issue.title: Can't open one app from another app
issue.body: ### Version 2.9.0 ### Reproduction link [https://github.com/dcolley/ns-open-app-issue](https://github.com/dcolley/ns-open-app-issue) ### Platform and OS info Mac Pro, 12.4 (21F79) ### Steps to reproduce I am able to open `myapp` from the IOS browser. Simply type: myapp://one?two=3 Also, browsing to a web page with `Launch App` also works I am not able launch the app from another app: ### What is expected? The other app opens, or IOS prompts for confirmation ### What is actually happening? sharedApplication.canOpenURL(url) reports false, so it can't open the custom url --- I tried Utils.openUrl(url) and https://github.com/nativescript-community/universal-links Neither of these are working.

comment.body:
We are locking this issue because it has been closed for more than 14 days. 
  
If the issue comes up again please open a new issue with additional details.

issue.body:
### Version

any

### Steps to reproduce
Click on a link to a PDF on the website embedded in WebView

the PDF is opened in a PDF view of the device or the PDF is downloaded

nothing

issue.title: chore(deps): bump minimatch and metalsmith-ignore

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

issue.body:
Bumps [minimatch](https://github.com/isaacs/minimatch) to 3.0.4 and updates ancestor dependency [metalsmith-ignore](https://github.com/segmentio/metalsmith-ignore). These dependencies need to be updated together. Updates `minimatch` from 0.2.14 to 3.0.4
Commits
  • e46989a v3.0.4
  • ddfacbd update brace-expansion
  • 55ed736 update package scripts and deps
  • eed8949 v3.0.3
  • ecabc57 Do not throw on unfinished !( extglob patterns
  • 81edb7c v3.0.2
  • 6944abf Handle extremely long and terrible patterns more gracefully
  • 8ac560e v3.0.1
  • 4f3a8bc update tap
  • 9cf2d88 Remove mentions of cache from readme
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view
Maintainer changes

This version was pushed to npm by isaacs, a new releaser for minimatch since your current version.


Updates `metalsmith-ignore` from 0.1.2 to 1.0.0
Changelog

Sourced from metalsmith-ignore's changelog.

v1.0.0

17 July 2018

  • Use multimatch() with the file list [#4](https://github.com/segmentio/metalsmith-ignore/issues/4)
  • Update multimatch to resolve deprecated dependency [#11](https://github.com/segmentio/metalsmith-ignore/issues/11)
  • add link to multimatch in readme [#6](https://github.com/segmentio/metalsmith-ignore/issues/6)
  • Removed unnecessary makefile and updated history 4631b17
  • Updated Packages 96ebad7
Commits
  • fbc4ba3 1.0.0
  • 4631b17 Removed unnecessary makefile and updated history
  • 96ebad7 Updated Packages
  • 2958c68 Merge pull request #4 from RobLoach/match-list
  • e3d5c2d Merge pull request #11 from woodyrew/patch-1
  • bc22bac Update multimatch to resolve deprecated dependency
  • 62a7ae7 Merge pull request #6 from arve0/patch-2
  • 1d4c894 add link to multimatch in readme
  • 190005a Use multimatch() with the file list
  • See full diff in compare view

Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---

issue.title: clearHistory is removing the Frame component when the Frame is in a component template
issue.body:
### Version
2.2.0

### Reproduction link
[https://play.nativescript.org/?template=play-vue&id=eA0tz9](https://play.nativescript.org/?template=play-vue&id=eA0tz9)
### Platform and OS info
Nativescript-Vue 2.2.0 / Android 7.0

### Steps to reproduce
My default Frame is in my App.vue component : 
```
<template>
    <Frame>
        <Page>
            <StackLayout>
                <Label>App.vue</Label>
                <Button text="Button" @tap="onButtonTap" />
            </StackLayout>
        </Page>
    </Frame>
</template>
```

I'm creating my Vue root instance without inserting Frame like that :
```
new Vue({
  render: h => h(App),
}).$start()
```

And when i use a $navigateTo with clearHistory set as true, the default Frame from App.vue will be removed and i will not be able to navigate anymore.

I've created a reproduction link with Nativescript Playground so you can see what's is happening

### What is expected?
The default frame has not to be deleted

### What is actually happening?
The default frame is removed

<!-- generated by nativescript-vue-issue-helper. DO NOT REMOVE -->

comment.body:
We are locking this issue because it has been closed for more than 14 days. 
  
If the issue comes up again please open a new issue with additional details.
